config_description: Defensive settings for protecting Cassandra from true network partitions. See (CASSANDRA-14358) for details.  The amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' is used to set the amount of time to wait for internode tcp connections to establish. The method tcpConnectTimeoutInMS() returns the value of 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' if it is not null, otherwise it retrieves the value from DatabaseDescriptor.getInternodeTcpConnectTimeoutInMS().
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration depends on the specific use case and workload of the system. It is typically triggered when establishing internode tcp connections.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'internode_tcp_connect_timeout_in_ms' configuration option on the system is related to the time it takes to establish internode tcp connections. Setting this value too low may result in failed connections, while setting it too high may increase latency in the system.
